p.strong: TNM Definitions for Colon and Rectal Cancer

td.p: TX = Primary tumor cannot be assessed
T0 = No evidence of primary tumor
Tis = Carcinoma in situ: Bowen disease, high grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (HSIL), anal intraepitherlial neoplasia II=III (AIN II-III)
T1 = ≤ 2 cm or less in greater dimension
T4 = Any size; invades adjacent organ (e.g. vagina, urethra, bladder)
* Direct invasion of rectal wall, perirectal skin, subcutaneous tissue, or sphincter muscles) is not classified as T4.
NX = Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N0 = No regional lymph node metastases
N2 = Unilateral internal iliac and/or unilateral inguinal nodes
N3 = Perirectal and inguinal lymph nodes and/or bilateral internal iliac and/or bilateral inguinal lymph nodes
